summary: The document is a confidential government memorandum from August 21, 1962, which details the establishment and operational specifics of a domestic safehouse (Safehouse #405) located in Silver Spring, MD. This setup was conducted under the provisions of the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It includes comprehensive details regarding the property, the terms of the lease, a fabricated cover story for its use, the appointment of a case officer, and the financial logistics involved in maintaining the safehouse.
key_findings: The lease for the safehouse was established for a duration of six months, spanning from July 1, 1964, to December 31, 1964.
A fabricated cover story was created, associating the safehouse with a client linked to the Inter-University Committee for Political and Social Action.
Mr. Barney Hidalgo was officially appointed as the case officer responsible for overseeing the safehouse operations.
Financial responsibilities for the safehouse were assigned to the lessee, with instructions for all bills to be directed to the Safehouse Branch for processing.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
